channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: This Company is No Shop of Horrors. Perl role in Canberra, Australia
item.description: With a mission that includes developing cost-efficient genotyping technology and promoting the development of crops adapted to suit their environment, this is a company that cares about doing great things, and that level of dedication extends to their people. If you’re located within Australia and this role sounds too delicious to pass up, drop us an email.

item.title: Goodbye, Winter Blues. Hello, 300 Days of Perl Sunshine! Perl developer job in Malta
item.description: Our client is a financial company whose growth over the last twenty years has been nothing short of impressive. They started with the idea that online trading should be available to all, and from there, they’ve built a company with multiple locations worldwide. If you want to be part of a business that is thriving, this may be the perfect opportunity for you.

item.title: Business Casual has a Whole New Meaning. Perl role in South Germany
item.description: Online shopping, socializing, working—it’s a digital world now, which is perfect for our client. As an international IT company managing millions of domains for retail and corporate customers in nearly every country in the world, they’re busier than ever—and they need a few senior Perl developers to help them continue to thrive.

item.title: Free Lunch? Yes, Please. Perl job in Vienna.
item.description: One of the largest product and price comparison platforms in German-speaking countries is on the hunt for a Perl programmer who wants to use their skills to eradicate inflated prices. The successful candidate will relish the chance to join a team that attributes nearly two decades of success to an uncompromising commitment to transparency, objectivity, and quality content.

item.title: How do you look in a fig leaf? Perl role in Cambridge, UK
item.description: This organization is one of the world’s leading developers of medical diagnostic technologies and clinical software. They believe in security, wellness, and the importance of driving innovation to deliver patient benefit. In short: do-gooders doing good! Isn’t it about time you felt positive about what you do?

item.title: German Perl Workshop 2021
item.description: It will be in Leipzig on March 24-26 2021. CFP is open.

item.description: The course is now ready for you to watch.

item.title: Weekly Challenge 092
item.description: Simon kept his solution and discussion to the point. Good job.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 92: Isomorphic Interval
item.description: Roger in-line comment makes it so easy to follow the code. Highly Recommended.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 92
item.description: Luis discussion of Insert Interval task is exceptional. Highly Recommended.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 92: Isomorphic Strings and Insert Intervals
item.description: Like always, Laurent discuss all the possible ways of dealing with the task. Must Read.

item.title: Perl weekly challenge 92
item.description: James dealing with Insert Interval in a very unique way. Must Read.

item.title: Solving Perl Weekly Challenge 092 -- Isomorphic Strings and Insert Interval.
item.description: Kang-min shared plenty of choices for each task. Highly Recommended.

item.title: PWC092 - Insert Interval
item.description: Flavio pictorial breakdown of Insert Interval task is really cool. Must Read.

item.title: PWC092 - Isomorphic Strings
item.description: Flavio knows the art of breaking task into pieces and then everything looks so simple and easy. Great job.

item.title: My Lava Lamp Pulsates in Harmony with the String Section
item.description: Reading Colin blog is always magical. It feels like reading fictional novel. Incredible kill.

item.title: Isomorphic Insertation with Raku
item.description: With the power of Raku, Arne made the tasks look so easy. As always the detailed discussion is exceptionally good.

item.title: Raku Challenge, Week 92, Issue 1
item.description: Andrew explained the Isomorphic Strings task so beautifully. Must Read.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 92, Part 2
item.description: Abigail turned the harder task into a simple one. Plenty to learn from him. Highly Recommended.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 92, Part 1
item.description: Abigail has always surprised me with his analytical thought. Impressive.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 92
item.description: Aaron sharing Raku gems with detailed description.

item.title: Perl Review - Perl Weekly Challenge - 090
item.description: Perl Solutions Review by Colin Crain.

item.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 092
item.description: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by the Team PWC dealing with the "Isomorphic Strings" and "Insert Interval" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 093
item.description: Welcome a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Max Points" and "Sum Path". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read FAQ page.

item.title: The Definitive Conway's Game of Life
item.description: Flavio introducing the Conway's Game of Life.

item.title: Generalized Chinese Remainder Theorem
item.description: Flavio playing with Chinese Remainder Theorem. Nice trick with numbers.

item.title: First Perl Steering Council elected to replace Pumpking position
item.description: Introduction to the Perl Steering Council members.

item.title: Blogs
item.description: Number of posts last week: BPO: 6; DevTo: 3; Perl.com: 0; PerlAcademy: 0; PerlHacks: 0; PerlMaven: 0; Reddit: 19; TPF: 1;

item.title: CPAN uploads
item.description: Last week there were a total of 190 uploads to CPAN of 132 distinct distributions by 71 different authors. Number of distributions with link to VCS: 112. Number of distros with CI: 65. Number of distros with bugtracker: 98.

item.title: The Top 10 Programming Tasks That Perl Is Used For
item.description: In today’s cloud-centric age, Perl remains a highly valuable and versatile tool. To prove the point, here’s a countdown of the top ten most common tasks that Perl is used for. You can (arguably) accomplish these more easily with Perl even today!

item.title: #492 - Perl Steering Council Election
item.description:
Hi there

Merry Christmas & Happy New Year

Finally we now have 3 elected members i.e. Ricardo Signes, Neil Bowers and Sawyer X of Perl Steering Council Election. Hearty congratulations to all three members. If anyone interested in the voting process then please follow Poll Results: Perl Steering Council Election page.

Are you interested in Perl 7 updates?

I found two very insightful source with regard to Perl 7 news e.g. Perl 7 FAQ and RFC -- Evolving Perl: a Decision Theory Approach to the Challenges of Perl 7.

I am sure you must have enjoyed the flood of many Advent Calendars, specially Perl Advent Calendar 2020. We also had mix bag of Perl and Raku gems making up the The Weekly Challenge Advent Calendar 2020.

Did you miss something this festive season? I did.

Well, I didn't hear any noise with regard to the most loved annual event 24PullRequest. In the past, start of december means two things for me, one is Advent Calendar and the second is 24PullRequest challenge. What a shame I didn't participate this year. I hope new year 2021 would bring the fresh energy.

Enjoy the rest of the newsletter
